intro: Sanicula simulans, commonly known as the false buttonweed, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in umbrella-like clusters called umbels, which attract various pollinators. Sanicula simulans thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
